info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 7 at 9:13PM EDT until April 9 at 3:20AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis IN
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana...
Mill Creek near Cataract.
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana...
Sugar Creek near Edinburgh.
...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Indiana...
Flatrock River at Saint Paul.
Sugar Creek at New Palestine.
.Flooding has ended on the Flatrock River at Saint Paul and on Sugar Creek at New Palestine. Minor Flooding will continue into Tuesday on Mill Creek near Cataract and on Sugar Creek near Edinburgh.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Sugar Creek near Edinburgh.
* WHEN...Until early Wednesday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, At least one cabin begins to flood with several more threatened by flood waters. Extensive flooding of a few county roads near Sugar Creek.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 PM EDT Monday the stage was 12.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:00 PM EDT Monday was 16.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening and continue falling and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind.
The next statement should be issued this evening by around 1015 PM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING
